alert.note: Alert for Cache Valley, Utah Portion; Eastern Box Elder County; Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains; Northern Wasatch Front; Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 10 at 2:43PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT WESTERN WEBER...CACHE AND NORTHEASTERN BOX ELDER COUNTIES... At 243 PM MST...A snow squall was along a line extending from 9 miles east of Franklin to Wellsville to 16 miles northwest of Hooper...and moving east at 40 mph. Locations impacted include... Ogden, Logan, Brigham City, Tremonton, Cache, North Ogden, Smithfield, Hyrum, Hooper, Perry, Wellsville, Willard, Lewiston, Marriott-Slaterville, Bear River City, Mantua, Corinne, Clarkston, Trenton, and Plymouth. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 345 and 396. Interstate 84 between mile markers 35 and 42. US Route 89 between mile markers 459 and 474. * winds in excess of 35 mph are possible with this squall. * visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter mile in this squall. * sudden and brief snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are possible in this squall. Rapid visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to produce hazardous driving conditions. Travel is not advised during this snow squall. If you are traveling and encounter adverse winter driving conditions, reduce speed and make sure headlights are on to increase the visibility of your vehicle to those around you. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
